name: Coral Bark Maple
climate: The Coral Bark Maple thrives in temperate climates with cool summers.
It can tolerate a moderate amount of frost, making it suitable for cooler areas.
This tree prefers regions with mild winters and no harsh conditions.
Humidity levels should not be excessively high for optimal growth.
sunlight: Prefers full sun but can also grow in partial shade conditions.
Ensure the tree gets at least 6 hours of direct sunlight every day.
In excessively hot climates, some afternoon shade may be beneficial.
Avoid placing it in complete shade as this hampers its growth.
watering: Requires regular watering, especially during dry periods.
Ensure the soil is consistently moist but not waterlogged.
During the growing season, water more frequently than in winter.
Avoid letting the soil dry out completely to prevent stress.
soil: Prefers well-drained soil with a pH level of 5.5 to 6.5.
Loamy soil mixed with organic matter promotes healthy growth.
Ensure good drainage to prevent root rot or other issues.
Avoid heavy clay soils or overly sandy soils for best results.
extra_care_tip: Prune the Coral Bark Maple in late winter to early spring to maintain shape.
Protect young trees from frost and excessive wind to prevent damage.
